formattedAddress: 1 New York Plaza, 2 Water St #1, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 New York Plaza, 2 Water St #1, New York, NY 10004, USA

editorialSummary.text: Counter-serve chain where guests create their own salads or wraps from a large array of ingredients.

originalText.text:
I've been a loyal patron of Chopt Salad in the Financial District for its convenience to my workplace and its healthy offerings. But my recent visit left me with a stomach-churning discovery that's really bugged me out.  Digging into my salad, I was disgusted to uncover a half-eaten insect! While I appreciate the shared dining experience, I usually prefer my salads without the extra crunch of surprise guests

It's disheartening to think that a place I frequented for its health benefits could overlook such a basic hygiene issue - especially for $16. I'm truly repulsed and shaken and will need a while, before I can trust diving into a salad without fearing what insects I might be crunching into.

While I appreciate the shared dining experience, I usually prefer my salads without the extra crunch of surprise guests

It's disheartening to think that a place I frequented for its health benefits could overlook such a basic hygiene issue - especially for $16. I'm truly repulsed and shaken and will need a while, before I can trust diving into a salad without fearing what insects I might be crunching into.

originalText.text:
They have nice variety of cold plus hot salads, been here multiple times so a review was due.

Customers can either select their original menu salad or can make their own. Prices will range between 9-14$ for a bowl with/without customization. If you are visiting during 12-1:30 pm on a weekday, there will be rush (so be patient,queue moves real quick) and staff does its best to pay heed on customization request.
I personally prefer there regular classic chopt (cold) and Warm chicken tinga(hot).
Please note if you don’t have taste developed for hot salad bases you might not like it.

originalText.text: Pretty good salad and grain bowl options.

text.text: Pretty good salad and grain bowl options.

originalText.text: Love the product and the order ahead option but be sure to add at least 15-20 minutes to the estimated pick up time. I have on multiple occasions had to ask employees more than once about the status of my order. This defeats the purpose of the order ahead as I am spending 20-30 minutes extra while they make the order after missing the original time.

text.text: Love the product and the order ahead option but be sure to add at least 15-20 minutes to the estimated pick up time. I have on multiple occasions had to ask employees more than once about the status of my order. This defeats the purpose of the order ahead as I am spending 20-30 minutes extra while they make the order after missing the original time.

originalText.text: Chopt has delicious salad choices and some bowls that include healthy grains and a variety of lettuce. Don't be scared if there is a long line, they handle the crowd pretty well. Just take you're ticket and follow your salad. They also offer some seasonal salads that change throughout the year. My only two complaints are I wish it was less expensive. (It's about $11.50 for a salad) I also wish they had a refillable drink fountain with only healthy options such as tea and sparkling water. I can u derstand why they don't have a soda fountain, but some non bottled drink options other than water .
